articles.title: ‘It’s A Number That’s Worth Paying Attention To’: Understanding Private Equity’s Role In Home-Based Care
articles.description: Despite the hype surrounding private equity's role in home-based care a new report reveals that its actual influence is far less significant than many believe.

articles.title: Why Private Equity’s Involvement In Home-Based Care Is Largely Overstated
articles.description: Despite recent scrutiny private equity's impact on home-based care is not as widespread as many believe.

articles.title: Enhabit’s Board Battle Continues, Advisory Firm Partially Sides With Activist Investor
articles.description: An independent advisory firm recommends that Enhabit Inc shareholders vote for three of the activist investor's board nominees citing the need for more home health and hospice experience on the board.

articles.title: The Pennant Group Agrees To $80M Purchase Of Pacific Northwest Home Health Provider
articles.description: Pennant Group expands its reach in the Pacific Northwest with an $80 million acquisition of Signature Healthcare at Home a move that strengthens its presence in Washington Oregon and Idaho.

articles.title: Pennant acquires Signature Healthcare at Home assets for $80M
articles.description: The Pennant Group a provider of home health personal care hospice and senior living services disclosed Thursday that it agreed to purchase assets of certain Signature Healthcare at Home affiliates.

articles.title: All The Payment Factors Included In The 2025 Home Health Proposed Rule
articles.description: This article breaks down the proposed payment factors for home health agencies in the 2025 rule.

articles.title: CMS Model Aims to Improve Dementia Care
articles.description: CMS is implementing a new model to improve care for dementia patients.

articles.title: NAHC-NHPCO Alliance Joint Statement: Comment Letter Submitted on Hospice CARE Act
articles.description: The NAHC-NHPCO Alliance submits a comment letter on the Hospice CARE Act outlining their stance on hospice payment reform and program integrity.

articles.title: NAHC-NHPCO Alliance Seeks Member Input on HHA Referral Process
articles.description: The National Association for Home Care Hospice (NAHC) and the National Hospice and Palliative Care Organization (NHPCO) are seeking input from members on the home health agency referral process.

articles.title: CMS Medicaid Updates
articles.description: This NAHC Report article provides an update on the latest CMS Medicaid changes that impact home care agencies.

articles.title: Proposed New OASIS Items
articles.description: The National Association for Home Care Hospice (NAHC) is proposing new OASIS items to enhance the accuracy and completeness of patient data.

articles.title: Independence at Home beneficiaries posed heavy financial strain on Medicare, study finds
articles.description: A new study reveals that Independence at Home a program designed to provide primary care in the home for high-cost Medicare beneficiaries placed a significant financial burden on traditional Medicare.

articles.title: Telemedicine firm adds palliative care specialty to improve access in rural areas
articles.description: Palliative care could be considered the Steve Wozniak of medical specialties Like the little-known co-founder of Apple Computer it is frequently misunderstood and seldom given its due Eagle Telemedicine.

articles.title: Study finds possible new target for early treatment of Alzheimer's disease
articles.description: New research has found that a protein that regulates cell repair could be a promising new target for treating Alzheimer’s disease.

articles.description: Researchers have devised a predictive model that could help doctors predict stages of cognitive decline tied to Alzheimer's disease They are now.

articles.title: Researchers successfully rejuvenate aging livers in preclinical study
articles.description: A study conducted in mice and human cell samples suggests that a pharmacological intervention may help reverse age-related liver damage.

articles.title: Novel method may erase 'bad memory' response to long-term Parkinson's treatment
articles.description: Scientists have discovered that inhibiting a protein could stop dyskinesia symptoms and erase the brain's "bad memory response to long-term.

articles.title: Some diabetes drugs like Ozempic may lower risks of 10 cancers, study finds
articles.description: People taking diabetes drugs such as GLP-1RAs saw a significant reduction in their risk of 10 out of 13 obesity-associated cancers a new study showed.

articles.title: Turning ‘Pain Points’ Into ‘Bliss Points’: The Chief Experience Officer’s Rise In Home-Based Care
articles.description: This article explores the growing importance of the Chief Experience Officer role in home-based care highlighting how these executives are transforming pain points into positive experiences for patients clients and staff.

articles.title: Senior Helpers, AccordCare See Results From Enhanced Training Programs
articles.description: Enhanced training programs are helping home care providers like Senior Helpers and AccordCare combat staffing shortages and improve caregiver retention.

articles.title: NYU’s College of Nursing receives $5M to provide aging care training
articles.description: HRSA granted New York University’s Rory Meyers College of Nursing $5 million to train 5,000 on providing aging-friendly care.

articles.description: Despite steady investments in the direct care workforce many home care agencies still struggle to recruit and retain essential workers.
